channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: This nation has the fastest rising rate of cancer cases -- and deaths -- in the world
item.description: According to a new report, cancer rates are skyrocketing in this tiny country. What's causing this to happen? And what steps can be taken to turn the tide?
item.content:encoded:
According to a new report, cancer rates are skyrocketing in this tiny country. What's causing this to happen? And what steps can be taken to turn the tide?

(Image credit: Joseph Eid/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Iceland reports the presence of mosquitoes for the first time, as climate warms
item.description: The discovery of three Culiseta annulata mosquitoes was confirmed this week by the Natural Science Institute of Iceland, which said the mosquitoes likely arrived by freight.
item.content:encoded:
The discovery of three Culiseta annulata mosquitoes was confirmed this week by the Natural Science Institute of Iceland, which said the mosquitoes likely arrived by freight.

(Image credit: Robert Pickett)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Confused by the U.S. economy? You're not alone
item.description: How are changing tariffs, the AI boom, immigration policies and uncertainty in employment and the stock market impacting the economy? Zanny Minton Beddoes, editor in chief of The Economist, explains.
item.content:encoded: How are changing tariffs, the AI boom, immigration policies and uncertainty in employment and the stock market impacting the economy? Zanny Minton Beddoes, editor in chief of The Economist, explains.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Greetings from an Indian Railways coach, with spectacular views from Mumbai to Goa
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.content:encoded: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: VP Vance tries to progress Gaza ceasefire. And, White House demolition draws critics
item.description: Vice President JD Vance is in Israel to address challenges in the Gaza ceasefire. And, the demolition of the East Wing of the White House has drawn criticism and raised questions about ethics.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President JD Vance is in Israel to address challenges in the Gaza ceasefire. And, the demolition of the East Wing of the White House has drawn criticism and raised questions about ethics.

(Image credit: Fadel Senna)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Mental exercise can reverse a brain change linked to aging, study finds
item.description: Scientists have found the first compelling evidence that cognitive training can boost levels of a brain chemical that typically declines as people age.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists have found the first compelling evidence that cognitive training can boost levels of a brain chemical that typically declines as people age.

(Image credit: adventtr/iStockphoto)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: The federal government is still shut down. Here's what that means across the country
item.description: The federal government remains shut down. The NPR Network is following the ways the shutdown is affecting services across the country.
item.content:encoded:
The federal government remains shut down. The NPR Network is following the ways the shutdown is affecting services across the country.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: The NPR Network

item.title: Mamdani's rise in NYC reflects a generational fight within the Democratic Party
item.description: Newcomer Zohran Mamdani, age 34, has used social media and big progressive ideas to shoulder past Andrew Cuomo, who's 67 and long a member of Democratic Party royalty.
item.content:encoded:
Newcomer Zohran Mamdani, age 34, has used social media and big progressive ideas to shoulder past Andrew Cuomo, who's 67 and long a member of Democratic Party royalty.

(Image credit: Angelina Katsanis)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Trump uses 'common sense' to make a political point. It has populist appeal
item.description: The phrase appeals more to several demographics that strongly align with Trump, says Republican strategist Frank Luntz, including older voters, for whom he suggests it signals "a more simple past."
item.content:encoded:
The phrase appeals more to several demographics that strongly align with Trump, says Republican strategist Frank Luntz, including older voters, for whom he suggests it signals "a more simple past."

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch and Joe Griffin/Hulton Archive)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: American 'Bibisitters' try to keep the Israel-Hamas truce on track
item.description: Several top U.S. officials are in Israel to shore up the Gaza ceasefire and attempt to bring about a permanent end to the war. They acknowledge the next phase poses serious challenges.
item.content:encoded:
Several top U.S. officials are in Israel to shore up the Gaza ceasefire and attempt to bring about a permanent end to the war. They acknowledge the next phase poses serious challenges.

(Image credit: Marc Israel Sellem)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre
